intro: Lappula himalayensis, commonly known as Himalayan lappula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with a fine layer of hair, which helps reduce water loss. Lappula himalayensis is often found in alpine meadows and is a hardy species that thrives in high-altitude conditions.
